question: Which two nations were involved in the "1992 Consensus"?
explanation: China and Taiwan were the two nations involved in the 1992 Consensus. It is also known as "One China Consensus". This consensus was based on "One-China Principle" in which both mainland China and Taiwan constitute "One China" and both are free to interpret the meaning of "One China" according to their discretion, which leads to "One Country, Two Systems".
